name: Andel's Hotel Cracow

reviews.text: A group of 6 ladies on the rong side of 40 stayed here for a long weekend.
reviews.title: Spot on in Krackow

reviews.text: We found the location to be fantastice, close to everything. The staff are very helpful, and we where lucky enough to get a free upgrade from the executive rooms to two apartments out of the 3 rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice area.

reviews.text: The beds I just wanted to take home as they are better than mine so comfy you don't want to leave them
reviews.title: Great hotel, highly recommended

reviews.text: The breakfasts,was very good. Although one morning we had to que it was still extremely nice, and try the omlettes that they cook fresh in front of you, lots to choose from.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Would definately recomend this Hotel group as we stayed in an Andels in Prague last year and had the same superb service
reviews.title: Good hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Andels hotel was a great hotel with great location. We requested the hotel car pick us up at the airport and the driver was there complete with sign. It was an excellent service. The hotel was clean, of a nice size and complete with robes and slippers. Please note that the standard room may be two single beds or a king size. If you are that bothered, like me, you can ask and they will change your room if they are able to do so. The staff at reception were very helpful and always very polite. Cracow tours pick up from Andels making any excursion very easy to arrange/book.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location and value for money

reviews.text: The hotel is right next to a huge shopping centre and you can see the train station from the rear of the hotel. The hotel is about a 10min walk to the main market square. If you want to visit kazimer its about a 25min walk, there are trams and buses but we never used these.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay thanks to Andel's!

reviews.text: Our guide book said a taxi to the airport to the main centre would be 30-50pln, so on the way back to the airport we took a taxi (right outside hotel) this cost us 100PLn, so I would really recommend you use the service of the hotel transfer if not using the train. This is a good saving and much more comfortable and friendly service (taxi drivers are a little wreckless).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel provides access to two computers with free internet access/printing facilities which is very handy when doing things about the city.
reviews.title: Very good right on the edge of the city

reviews.text: All in Krakow is a lovely city with lots to do and see, great value for money and hotel Andels made our stay most enjoyable and very easy. The hotel staff will pretty much do anything they are able to in order to provide a proffesional,friendly service.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a few quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is lovely - it looks hideous from the outside but once inside it is stunning! It has a great location by the main station so you can be at the airport within 15 minutes and in the beautiful historic centre within 5 minutes. Next door is an enormous shopping centre too which we found offered welcome warmth from the snow!
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by its cover!

reviews.text: Rooms are very spacious and well equip - very swanky as you would expect from Andels. The communal areas are also excellent - the main bar is great and does superb cocktails and the restaurant's breakfast buffet is very good.
reviews.title: Great, just buy new Polish feather filled pillows!

reviews.text: The only problem we had was we were placed along a corridor amonst a Canadian school group who were incredibly noisy - the next morning we complained about this and were allocated a new room straight away - great service!
reviews.title: Brilliant - comfy and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a stay at the Andels and must say I enjoyed it very much. Very efficient check in and friendly staff. My rate included breakfast and the buffet was very tasty and plentiful. The location is great and my room was clean and well laid out even though it was not large. My only complaint is the pillows, they were not the great typical Polish pillows that you can shape and mold. If management reads my review, contact the Warsaw Sheraton and buy their kind of pillows! Otherwise, an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Location Location

reviews.text: This is a really excellent hotel, very stylishly decorated and feels much more like a 5*! The rooms were very clean, cleaned daily with excellent little touches. Tour coaches leave from the hotel every day to sites around Krakow and beyond and the onsite restaurant is second to none; excellent selection of continental and Polish food.
reviews.title: Best Place for Train Travelers to Stay!
The Most relaxing hotel I have ever stayed in! Wonderful staff & hotel
reviews.text: the accommodation is excellent, this is the second stay in 2009, both times were excellent, always surprised by something better every time. food was amazing, staff were fantastic, rooms were large, comfortable and very reasonable price for the accommodation you get.
whenever i go back to Krakow ill stay there & would highly recommend to anyone considering krakow.
reviews.title: Great location, modern hotel, comfortable and functional.

reviews.text: Its so central & convenient too!
reviews.title: PERFECT in every way:-location, rooms&food

reviews.text: Great location 5 minute walk from the main drag in the old town. Turn right out of the lobby door facing the square on the ground floor and go under the underpass. Bear right in the gardens - past the yellow rental bike - and you are in the old town.
reviews.title: Just perfect!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is modern and clean. I had a room overlooking the main road - not a particularly great outlook but being on the 5th floor there was no noise - perhaps lower down is ok too. Mini bar prices in the room are (as usual) exhorbitant! Why do hotels never learn? Reasonable priced drinks in the mini bar = usage, crazy prices = no sale!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, extremely good service and great value

description: The 4-star Andel’s Hotel Cracow is situated directly in city center, just 100 metres from Market Square, the largest shopping mall in the city and the main train station (12 minutes to the airport). It contains 159 luxurious rooms and apartments and is the only design hotel in Cracow. The spacious modern conference centre makes the hotel ideal for business meetings and events.
